content.question: The linear transformation function <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="L open parentheses vector v close parentheses equals A times vector v"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math>, where <math alttext="A"><mi>A</mi></math> is a <math alttext="2 by 2"><mn>2</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>2</mn></math> matrix and <math alttext="vector v"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> is a column vector. If <math alttext="A equals a 2 by 2 matrix with row 1 column 1 value negative 3, row 1 column 2 value 7, row 2 column 1 value 11, row 2 column 2 value negative 5"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>7</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>11</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="vector k equals a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value negative 8, row 2 column 1 value 5"><mover><mi>k</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>, what is <math alttext="L open parentheses vector k close parentheses"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mover><mi>k</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></mfenced></math> ?

<math alttext="a 2 by 1 matrix with row 1 column 1 value 59, row 2 column 1 value negative 113"><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>59</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mo>-</mo><mn>113</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Express functions, equations, or expressions in analytically equivalent forms that are useful in a given mathematical or applied context.
